chainsaw.lazy.mathsaw — Mathing chainsaw¶

class chainsaw.lazy.mathsaw(*things, **kw)[source]¶

mathing chainsaw

append(thing)¶

Insert thing after any other incoming things.

Parameters:thing – incoming thing
as_ascii(errors='strict')¶

Set iterable wrapper to byte encode outgoing things with the 'ascii' codec.

Parameters:errors (string) – error handling for decoding issues
as_auto()¶

Let incoming things be automatically rebalanced with outgoing things.

as_bytes(encoding='utf-8', errors='strict')¶

Set iterable wrapper to byte encode outgoing things.

Parameters:
  • encoding (string) – Unicode encoding
  • errors (string) – error handling for encoding issues
as_dict()¶

Set iterable wrapper to cast outgoing things to dict.

as_edit()¶

Work on incoming things without automatically reverting back to a baseline snapshot when commit() is invoked.

as_list()¶

Set iterable wrapper to cast outgoing things to list.

as_manual()¶

Disallow incoming things from being manually rebalanced with outgoing things.

as_multi()¶

Treat each incoming thing as one processing unit within a series of processing units.

as_one()¶

Treat multiple incoming things as one processing unit.

as_query()¶

Work on incoming things where incoming things revert to a baseline snapshot when close() is invoked.

as_set()¶

Set iterable wrapper to cast outgoing things to set.

as_tuple()¶

Set iterable wrapper to cast outgoing things to tuple.

as_unicode(encoding='utf-8', errors='strict')¶

Set iterable wrapper to unicode (str under Python 3) decode outgoing things.

Parameters:
  • encoding (string) – Unicode encoding
  • errors (string) – error handling for decoding issues
average()¶

Find average value within an iterable.

Return type:number
balanced¶

If outgoing and incoming things are in balance.

clear()¶

Clear everything.

clear_in()¶

Clear incoming things.

clear_out()¶

Clear outgoing things.

close()¶

Close current edit or query session and return outgoing things wrapped in the iterable wrapper.

commit()¶

Close query session and return outgoing things wrapped with the iterable wrapper.

count()¶

Count how many times each thing occurs within an iterable.

Returns:tuple consisting of (least common thing, most common thing, count of everything consisting of a list of tuple pairs of (thing, count).
Return type:tuple
extend(things)¶

Insert things after any other incoming things.

Parameters:things – incoming things
extendfront(things)¶

Insert things before any other incoming things.

Parameters:things – incoming things
in_out()¶

Copy incoming things to outgoing things for output.

max()¶

Find maximum value within an iterable using the worker as the key function.

Return type:number
median()¶

Find median value within an iterable.

Return type:number
min()¶

Find minimum value within an iterable using the worker as the key function.

Return type:number
minmax()¶

Find minimum and maximum values within an iterable.

Returns:tuple of (minimum value, maximum value).
Return type:tuple
out_in()¶

Copy outgoing things back to incoming things for further processing.

params(*args, **kw)¶

Assign global positional or keyword params used when the worker is invoked.

pattern(pattern, type='parse', flags=0)¶

Compile a search pattern and use it as the worker.

Parameters:
  • pattern (string) – search pattern
  • type (string) – engine to compile pattern with. Valid options are ‘parse’, ‘re’, or ‘glob’
  • flags (integer) – regular expression flags
prepend(thing)¶

Insert thing before any other incoming things.

Parameters:thing – incoming thing
preview()¶

Take a peek at the current state of outgoing things.

range()¶

Find length of the smallest interval that can contain everything within an iterable.

Return type:number
snapshot(baseline=False, original=False)¶

Take a snapshot of the current state of incoming things.

Parameters:
  • baseline (boolean) – make snapshot the baseline snapshot
  • original (boolean) – make snapshot the original snapshot
sum(start=0, precision=False)¶

Find total value by adding start and everything within an iterable together.

Parameters:
  • start (integer or float) – starting number
  • precision (boolean) – add floats with extended precision
Return type:

number
tap(call)¶

Assign worker.

Parameters:call – a callable
undo(snapshot=0, baseline=False, original=False)¶

Revert incoming things back to a previous snapshot.

Parameters:
  • snapshot (integer) – number of steps ago e.g. 1, 2, 3
  • baseline (boolean) – revert incoming things to baseline snapshot
  • original (boolean) – revert incoming things to original snapshot
untap()¶

Remove worker and global positional and keyword params.

unwrap()¶

Set iterable wrapper to cast outgoing things to list.

wrap(wrapper)¶

Assign iterable wrapper for outgoing things.

Parameters:wrapper –

an iterable wrapper
